The picture quality is amazing!!!!  Love that the 10 second low light exposure feature allowed me to get decent shots of the Northern lights.  I cannot get over the quality of photos this phone has!  No regrets!

Heading: Fantastic upgrade that is surprisingly worth it
Text:
Coming from an iPhone XS Max, I didn’t to be wowed by the iPhone 11 Pro Max. But after using it for a couple of weeks, I have really appreciated the improvements that have been made. The battery life is the best I’ve seen in an iPhone. I’m getting whole day battery life with the screen brightness at 1/5 the bar, a big improvement to the XS Max which I kept the brightness lower. The cameras are also greatly improved, which the ultra wide lense and Night Mode have made taking pictures more fun and satisfying. The front camera finally brings a wider camera making group pictures much easier to frame. The loss of 3D Touch is unfortunate as I really enjoyed using it in different ways, but I would rather sacrifice it if it means we continue to have much larger batteries going forward. The other differences such as the newer processor aren’t really noticeable but are likely important for more strenuous tasks and device longevity. Finally, the midnight green color is great.

Honestly I don’t think everyone should upgrade to this iPhone if their current iPhone is working fine. I upgraded because I lack self control and like having the latest, greatest iPhone. But if you are moving from a 8 or older, you’re in for a treat.

Heading: Battery Life and Camera’s are top notch!
Text:
I jump back from Android and iPhone fairly often. I feel confident that iPhone 11 Pro Max is sticking around for a while. The battery life is amazing! It’s one thing to hear about it, but another to see it in action! The battery lasts all day and that’s with me checking Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter pretty often along with using FaceTime and YouTube. I only need to charge when going to bed, but if I needed to charge because I’m heading somewhere the fast charging is super fast. Coming from a Pixel 3XL I’m no stranger to fast charge, but this seems much faster. 
Oh and the Camera’s. They are so great! I was apprehensive about leaving my Pixel’s camera behind especially with family moments and young kids, but the iPhone camera is really amazing. And the night shot feature is really good as well! 
The phone itself is iPhone. iOS, icons, notch, etc. none of those things are negatives for me, but consider that too when choosing between camps. 
Oh 1 more thing... the sound!! So loud and very good with the 3D feeling of the sound. It’s all software I’m assuming, but those speakers had me turning left and right even when watching a YouTube video! Great speakers! I thought I would miss forward facing speakers on my Pixel, but these are so good and loud!

Heading: Very happy with this phone.
Text:
I upgraded from an XR and can say this phone was a nice upgrade over that model and really enjoy using this phone.

The screen looks nice and pictures are awesome, but the real story here is the battery life. While the XR had great battery life the 11 Pro Max has phenomenal battery life. Apple has always done a great job  with standby battery usage, but the battery would drop quickly with heavier usage. The XR was better, but this Pro Max does not have that issue at all. I believe it is a combination of the larger battery and A13 chip efficiency. Consumer reports is reporting 40 hours of simulated user usage with the Pro Max versus 29 hours with the XS Max. 

This was an upgrade I was on the fence about, and honestly did it so I could pass the XR to my son. I had planned to wait until next year. 5G is not a big deal for me and my son needs a phone now. I also needed the 2x zoom on the camera. I like the 11 Pro Max has the lightning connector also since I have other devices that have the same connection. I can say the battery life and camera made the upgrade worth it. I am also glad I sprung for the 512 GB version because I am going to keep this phone for a while.

Heading: Another Great Release
Text: I’ll admit that I remain an Apple fan due to everything working well together and for it just fits my needs. This new one is definitely faster and new iOS makes it more intuitive. Camera is definitely better than the already good on in the XS Max and battery life is definitely better. Holds up after heavy use all day so far. If you want better battery life and camera upgrades this is headed in the right direction. iPhone XSMax pictures are amazing and who wouldn’t want longer battery without having to use battery packs.

Heading: Its All About Preference
Text: I used to work in the mobile section at best buy (between 2015 and 2018) and the iphone honestly hasnt evolved too much since around the iphone 6s. This isnt a bad thing honestly. Instead of striving for innovation they strive for perfection. The iphone is sleek, clean, and easy to use where as android is complex and customizable. When looking to purchase this phone I would base off what you currently have and what youre looking for. Iphone is very surface level and android lets you dive deep. At this point in the phone game it falls to preference. Both are great but I prefer iPhone and the apple ecosystem.

Heading: iPhone 11 Pro Max
Text: I originally wanted the Midnight Green but they sold out, so settled for the Space Gray, and I love it, my iPhone 10 Max was Space Gray as well. The battery life on this is the truth, I can literally get a entire day out it, and that’s including watching videos, playing games, and Surfing the web and social media, and Apple including the 18watt battery charger which is THE TRUTH meaning it WORKS I was like 13% late one night I plugged in the 18 watt charger And went from 13% to like 35% in like 15 minutes , IOS 13.1

Heading: Superior Customer Service
Text: The phone is amazing, as normal with Apple, but this post is more about my experience than the product. Best Buy sent me a great offer to trade in my iPhone X to get direct credit towards the purchase of an 11 Pro if I preordered. They gave me a great offer for my trade in, so I went ahead and accepted the offer. When I went to pick up my new phone, it refused to activate, and ended up being a system issue on. Verizon’s side. To make a long story short, I was in the store for about 5 hours while the mobile team did everything in their power to try and resolve the issue, but they were unable to. We ended up having to cancel the order and reorder a different phone. The perseverance and customer service that everyone from the mobile team showed me was AMAZING, and despite the frustration with the activation issue, I am even more loyal to Best Buy because of their hard work and great attitudes. Thank you to Lauren, Mikeah (spelling?), and Store Manager Tim.

Heading: All around GREAT iPhone! Worth the upgrade.
Text:
Coming from the iPhone XS Max makes this upgrade not as big as coming from an older model such as the 6S or 7,8 Plus however I’m still glad I upgraded. 
You can see the deeper contrast in the screen compared to the X, and XS. The cameras are amazing and the battery life is GREAT! depending on your use, I’ve been able to go two days without charging. The speed and smooth operation of the phone is what can be expected with a new iPhone and A13 chip. If you have an older plus model or even the X or XS I would definitely upgrade if you can afford it. Reception is also better than the XS Max.

Heading: Great camera
Text:
easy to Use
Good camera
Nice sounds
But heavy..
Thats the only thing i dont like with this..
But all in all is good

Heading: The iPhone 11 Pro Max is great.
Text: Short and sweet the phone is great.  I was impressed to see how fast and easy it was to set up.  That is once I got past an issue.  The phone I wanted, in Space Gray, was not in stock at the Best Buy store and had to be mailed to me.  It turned out the the Verizon SIM card that was included could not be recognized.  A Best Buy Support rep tried to help me and was unsuccessful.  I have to go to my local Verizon store to get help with the problem.  Turns out they only had to swap the SIM from my current phone to the new iPhone and subsequently everything went well with the setup.  Then came the next issue when I found that I couldn't make calls and would get a Verizon error message that the account was not active.  Fortunately a quick call to Verizon had this problem resolved.  I don't know why the Verizon support rep didn't think to check on that.

Heading: From android to iphone
Text:
My family have converted me to a IPhone user. I have been team android for many years. It was time for an upgrade so I finally convert to Apple. I am very please so far it has only been a week using my iPhone 11 pro max. I am still trying to navigate using this iPhone. It takes some getting use too not having an actual back button and the actual vibrate option. That is the reason for my rating of average on the ease of use.
Overall, once I become comfortable with using the iPhone I sure I will be please and never go back to an android phone.

Heading: Loveeeee
Text:
I’ll be honest when this phone first came out I hated it & thought the 3 cameras were ugly but then I warned up to it and it’s perfect
Not too sure on all the camera features but it dies take amazing pictures especially at night time.. we the flash it doesn’t even look like it was completely dark

Heading: Nice upgrade for 8+ and x users
Text: I have an XR on my business phone and would say that this is a small upgrade from last years phones unless you are a camera person. So upgrading from a XS,XSM, or XR is less likely that you will see huge improvement or need to upgrade. The one big difference I saw from my iPhone X is the battery life on the pro max is fantastic. I pull my phone off the charger before going to bed and I can still get through a whole day work day and not needing a charge until around 9-10pm. I would consider myself a power user as throughout the day I have emails, spreadsheets, and YouTube streaming in the background for 4-5 hours amongst other items. The cameras are a big improvement and really close the short fall they had in low light photography. The iPhone went from not competing in low light to trading blows with what is considered the best camera on a smartphone the google pixel. I can honestly say I’m not regretting my purchase and if you have a iPhone X or later the small improvements will make you happy with your purchase.

Heading: Fantastic Product!
Text:
This is a premier product. The wide angle lens is one of the original wide angle lenses and really adds the ability to get The Big picture. I've been wanting that feature for a while and comes in handy when you just can't backup any further due to obstructions. As for the other two lenses and the overall camera quality, it's fantastic.

I own other phones as well. Android is great, but if stability in updates is what you want, and you want the updates to keep coming - you can't beat Apple.

Remember this - Apple produces the OS and the iPhone. The two are mated together and maintained to high standards.

Heading: best Iphone yet
Text:
I have been using an iPhone 8plus and was very happy with everything , once this product was launched I just wanted to see one and experience the screen and camera. Let me say that if you do not have an iPhone X or above then you are missing out 
the screen is amazing and the new bionic chip makes using the phone and apps feel like the first time I used an iPhone, it is that much better. Last if you are not using best buy for all you electronic needs you need to switch and really look into what they do and how good their customer service is.  Apple has out done themselves!

Heading: Upgraded from iPhone 8 Plus
Text:
I have had this phone for about two weeks now and so far it’s been great.  I upgraded from an iPhone 8 Plus.  The screen has better resolution, the camera is great (for a phone).  One of the main things I like about the new phone is that it’s the size of my old iPhone 8 Plus but with a larger screen that’s sharper.  I have also noticed this phone is a tad quicker to load apps with the new processor.

One thing that I thought was going to be a problem for me is the lack of the home button on my other iPhones, but I was able to adjust after a day of using the phone.  Also the Face ID feature is a cool update and I have adjusted to this.

I would recommend this phone, just wish apple would calm down with the prices!

Heading: Worth the Upgrade
Text: First off S/O to Best Buy for not only having the phone in stock but having in my case Verizon experts in store. I’d like to start off by saying that the phone exceeded my expectations. As we all know phones nowadays are pretty much the same each year with minor updates (Android or Apple).As this may be true for this year’s model it still surpasses all previous generations. From the OS to the fast charge and yes even the obvious. The three cameras on the back which for me (a loyal phone photographer) is my favorite feature and update. The camera quality is beyond amazing. Anyway before I keep going on about how great this phone is go on in and buy one for yourself you wont regret it!

Heading: New to Apple
Text: I’ve been an Android user and this is my first Apple product. The switch is very easy, I find most everything to be very intuitive and user friendly. I can’t wait to dive into the triple cameras and see what I can create. The phone is very stout and feels expensive... and it is.

Heading: The cameras make it unbelievable
Text: I purchase a new iPhone every year and every year I am amazed at what Apple does with every new upgrade. Granted, some people say that some upgrades have been ho hum but this year Apple has come across with some game changers. The first big change is the cameras, they have to be experienced to be believed. The battery life is over the top improved. For most of my previous iPhones I purchased a battery case because they didn’t quite make it through the day but that won’t be necessary with this one. This phone has at least 30% battery at the end of a very heavy day of use. If you are an iPhone person, you have to seriously consider this one, it’s a true joy to behold.

Heading: Love the iPhone 11 Pro Max
Text: I upgraded so that my husband could have my “old” iPhone X. The biggest change in this new phone was the three cameras, but I haven’t used the special features that much. This one also has the bigger screen, which I love because it’s much easier for me to see and text on. I’m a big fan of Apple products because they all connect to one another and that makes it easier for me to sign into websites and apps across multiple devices. The price is high of course, but I was able to use some of my Best Buy rewards to help with that.

Heading: A new adventure from Androis
Text: I've owned a Samsung Galaxy from the first one they made.  I was very disappointed with the 7th generation but lived with it for several years.  I finally moved over to an iPhone and am very pleased with it.  The battery lasts forever!  The FaceTime feature is fun.  The only downside it that I had my Android completely customized with ringers and notifications for specific people in my contacts.  I highly recommend this phone!

Heading: Loving It
Text: By far the best iPhone I have had (it should be since it is the newest one) but what really impresses me is the extremely long battery life (I normally drain my battery by the afternoon because I am a heavy user of the phone but this phone lasts two days before I need to charge it) and the low light ability of the camera. I have been using Verizon with this phone and I now have better service with this phone and am getting 165 mbps on 4G LTE in some areas. It really is a great phone and is super fast.

Heading: Overall best iPhone ever!!!
Text: I have had both iPhone and android phones and i continue to come back to iPhone. Overall great built. Sturdy in hand and cameras are AMAZING!!! Great pictures no matter the lighting. Priced a bit high but as they say, you have to pay to play.

Heading: Awesome Phone
Text: I upgraded from a iPhone 7 plus to a iPhone 11 Pro Max and it is a big difference.  I had an adjustment with the 11 and no home button.  The quality of the camera is phenomenal.  However I did notice the 11 is slightly heavier than my 7 plus, but the size is the same.  I do like the fact that you don't have to press the home button twice to get all the open apps.  On the 11, you just swipe up on your bottom tool bar and all the apps that are open appear.  Overall I am thrilled with the 11.

Heading: Unbelievable battery life!!!
Text: Absolutely love this phone!! Camera is mind blowing and best of all, you get all day heavy battery life and that’s #1 to me!

Heading: Best I phone yet!
Text: Such an amazing product from Apple. Of you’re on the fence about upgrading take my advice and do it ! The camera, the battery, the specs... all of it is worth the buy.

Heading: A nice upgrade!
Text: I upgraded an iPhone 8+ to the iPhone 11 Pro Max and I’m thoroughly enjoying it. The camera quality is excellent, It’s very fast,  and feels very nice in the hand

Heading: so far we love it
Text: the camera is why we decided to upgrade and so far we are not disappointed.... i just hope the battery life stays as good as it is now. a few changes make for a little bit of a learning curve and alot of youtube watches to figure out how to do simple things and im not happy it does not come with the headphone/ charge combo jack and that i have to buy it on my own... for 1500 it should be included.... but thats apple for ya...

Heading: so far its great
Text: the camera is why we decided to upgrade and so far we are not disappointed.... i just hope the battery life stays as good as it is now. a few changes make for a little bit of a learning curve and alot of youtube watches to figure out how to do simple things and im not happy it does not come with the headphone/ charge combo jack and that i have to buy it on my own... for 1500 it should be included.... but thats apple for ya...

Heading: Upgrade from iPhone XS Max
Text: I had the silver iPhone XS Max and was going to skip this iPhone 11 Pro Max, but the cameras and sound quality is much better. I loved my XS Max, but I love this iPhone even more. For me I want the best quality in cameras, but if that does not matter to you, you may want to wait until next year. However, the battery life on this thing is astounding! A but heavier and thicker than last year, but that's what we wanted to get a bigger battery!

Heading: Great Iphone.
Text: Best iphone ever.  Improved face id. Fast processor. Great green Matt finish.  IOS13 is great.  Switch from S10 plus.  Only negative is too heavy which gives limited case. Also slightly wider than S10 plus.

Heading: It's good but...
Text: I switch back and forth between iPhones and Galaxy Notes. There are Pros and Cons with both. I LOVE iPhones because they just work! Hardly ever bugs. My work apps run faster and smoother. I just always have 100% confidence in the device. But the Cons from switching from the Note 9, this thing is heavy. It's really heavy compared to the Note 9. And it's also big. I'm a big guy with pretty big hands and I can't comfortably reach all corners with one hand. But this thing works so well that the Pros out weigh those Cons. It's not perfect but I'm happy with it.

Heading: Apple has continued!!
Text: I have had Samsung and apple. I know both are constantly competing. For me, iPhones have always been my favorite. This phone is no different. From the facial recognition to the camera to the speed of loading. This phone has been spectacular.

Heading: Wow
Text: I am not a "fanboy" of either Apple or Samsung, In fact, I own Motorola, OnePlus, and even Essential devices. It was not my intention to purchase this upon my BB visit. However, I am very pleased I did. The camera and its features are terrific. The build quality is what you would expect from Apple, outstanding. No lag moving through apps. Pricey=absolutley. Disappointment with the value=absolutley not.

Heading: Awesome phone. Best Buy sale price, too
Text: The is a great phone. I took advantage of Best Buy's sale price plus the trade in allowance for my iPhone 7 Plus. Stephen at the mobile counter made sure that everything was transferred from my old phone before wiping it out.

Heading: Excellent phone. Great camera and snappy performan
Text: Upgraded from a 6s, so of course I am impressed. My wife wanted me to update so I could send better photos of our son, and this phone definitely does not disappoint. While the camera appears to be the main marketing point, the phone itself performs great. It takes some getting used to the lack of home button, but the facial recognition seems to take care of any delays for unlocking the phone. Very happy with my upgrade

Heading: iPhones-they just work great!
Text: We’ve been using iPhones for years, and it was way past time for an upgrade.  My wife and each upgraded our phones at the same time, and really enjoy these latest models

Heading: Best iPhone ever
Text:
I love this new iPhone.  I traded in my iPhone 7Plus and it was worth the upgrade. 

The triple lens camera with night mode, 4K video are amazing, and of course the speed is sweet. The updated Face ID has been I joy. You can lie it down and it reads your Face ID smoothly.  The missing items was reverse charging and 5G, but the 5G is still new maybe by 2021 it will be more mainstream.

Heading: good but I like my iphone X better
Text:
it is a good cell phone but if you need to upgrade from iPhone X ?
I don't know. I still did not find anything really better than iPhone X. I guess it is just the way apple make their business. every year new generation iPhone and people spend money to get the newest one

Heading: Great overall phone
Text: I switched from Samsung to Apple.  I loved my Samsung but find the iPhone to be more intuitive.  I haven’t used the camera feature yet but am going to travel soon and am looking forward to using it.

Heading: Great simple upgrade over iPhone XS Max
Text: Great simple upgrade over iPhone XS Max, really happy that they finally listened to consumers, and increased battery life at the expense of thickness and weight. Great choice imo

Heading: I expected more
Text: iPhones are great, don’t get me wrong. The battery life on this phone is phenomenal and the camera is pretty awesome too, but, it has some downfalls. The day after I purchased the phone my notification sounds were glitchy a few times which was odd to me. I’ve never had that happen before with any other model and I’ve had almost every one. Just today my phone froze and shut off which, also, never happened before. I’m not sure if i just got a wonky one or what. I’m an iPhone lover and I have to have the latest one but I’m a little disappointed with this release. It’s very similar to the last phone.

Heading: Fancy. I had a 6S and this is a major improvement
Text: This phone is bigger in every way. Sound, feel, weight, power, battery life. Great stuff. I will coddle it for another several years as I did with the one I had. I wiped the other one and will use as a big iPod for the car/house.

Heading: Phone that is at first a phone
Text: If you want a phone that you can access voicemail, depend on applications not crashing and have the fastest phone tested to be faster than even the new Snapdragon 855 chipsets, this is the phone. It will not overheat, it will not crash and you get your phone and voicemail with some sense of privacy. Nothing new here, if you have one already though you only get a better camera.

Heading: Best iPhone ever
Text: I’ve been buying iPhones since the 3G model back in 2008. If you are a fan of iOS or Apple products in general this one doesn’t disappoint. I moved from an iPhone X to this one and feel it is worth the upgrade. The camera is excellent, the OLED screen is fantastic. Watching HDR video is like watching one of the LG OLED 4K TVs.

Heading: Amazing new iPhone
Text: Absolutely love the distinctive new design and the new cameras! Battery life is also significantly better compared to the iPhone XS max. Overall a great upgrade. I would highly recommend the iPhone pro max! I also love Best Buy‘s upgrade experience, it’s  super easy and convenient compared to going to the phone store.

Heading: The best !
Text: Traded in my pixel 3 and best decision I’ve made. The battery last forever and the camera is so good.

Heading: Great Camera
Text: The updates on the camera make me feel, and the end product look, like the pictures are taken professionally.  The portrait option has just gotten better and gets better with every upgrade in IOS.  It’s an Apple product so I wouldn’t expect anything but the best, especially for the price that is paid, but it is worth every penny.

Heading: BEST iPhone YET!!
Text: I had to replace my iPhone 6 Plus and went with the latest and best iPhone.  Very thin, excellent design and picture taking is great.  Will recommend for anyone.

Heading: Great camera
Text: great phone to replace my old one that is broken. Love the new camera in it. Fantastic pics captured

Heading: Best iPhone yet!!!
Text: I decided to get a new phone on release day, and I am so happy!  The phone itself has great battery life, a wonderful screen and the camera is just unbelievable.  The camera is so good that I now regret lugging around an expensive mirrorless rig.  I took a shot of a sunset that blows people away, especially when I tell them it’s from my iPhone.

Heading: Super
Text: I love the new iphone 11 pro max. The picture quality is amazing. Night shots look as if they were taken in daytime. Everything is super clear on it. I thought the iphone X was pretty good until I got the chance to see the difference the 11 makes. There is a learning curve with the 11. It's not cheap but the trade-in made it more affordable.

Heading: very fast
Text:
first time I have a Max or big iPhone, I was more incline to the small phones specially since I carry them in my pockets and run with it...
but lately start to do many thing in my phone almost not use the iPad any more, since the phone is at hand always.. chose this one .. no disappointment .

Heading: The camera is phenomenal
Text: This is the best iPhone yet, the camera is fast enough to capture my adorable impatient toddler!

Heading: Amazing Phone
Text: Amazing phone but I will never buy another phone online from Best Buy. Finally got the phone to work today after calling Verizon and waiting on hold 40 min. All the iPhone 11s Best Buy had we’re set for the wrong Activation date 5 days later. I love Best Buy but this was a terrible Experience. Had I traded in my phone I would not have had a working phone for days!!!!

Heading: Bought the first day
Text: I had been waiting anxiously for this release.  I bought it the first day at Best Buy. No wait and no line.  It has met my expectations so far.

Heading: If you need a larger screen this is it
Text: I wanted a larger phone and have been using apple devices for a while.  It's heavier than the older, smaller phones but if you know IOS there is not much else to say.  The new cameras take excellent pictures and video.  It's too soon to comment on battery life, but like the other phones I've had this is a solid device.

Heading: Another amazing device from Apple
Text: Upgraded from the X Max and don’t regret it one bit! The camera is unlike any camera that has graced the iPhone. Battery life is definitely an improvement from last years model (my biggest reason for wanting to upgrade). Love the midnight green coloring. Like always, apple has created a gorgeous device that works seamlessly with the IOS software.

Heading: Great new features
Text: My husband was having problems with his IPhone 6 keeping a charge. But new batteries would not get him new features and a better camera . He loves his new iPhone 11 ProMax. The pictures are terrific . It is so easy to use. Still learning all of the new features. So glad for the “11”.

Heading: Do not regret this purchase
Text: Really cannot speak highly enough about this phone. Finally switched over from years of Android OS phones. Everything, from the watch and the AirPods, works so flawlessly with one another comparative to Android based systems. Not quite as customizable as Android, but it’s worth the sacrifice, in my opinion.

Heading: Excellent upgrade
Text: Camera is fantastic really leaving little to no need for a dslr camera.  Phone is big but manageable.  iOS 13 has some upgrades that are advantageous such as night shots.  Overall the price is high and not necessarily worth spending that much each year but last phone was iPhone 6S+ so this is an excellent upgrade.

Heading: Very Beautiful Phone
Text: At first when I saw all the photos of the phone online, I feared that I wouldn’t like the design. But when you get the phone and look at it in person it’s beautiful. Other than a few iOS 13 glitches, the phone overall is wonderful. The camera is as amazing as advertised. If you have an older iPhone and you’re looking to upgrade, this phone is a good choice.

Heading: A week in, it's performing as advertised.
Text: A week in, the pricey device is performing as advertised--fast, crisp graphics, and even a slowfie / slofie shot taken for kicks and giggles turned out like I gather a slowfie / slofie should.  Still getting used to Face ID (not a fingerprint) opening up apps and saving passwords, but I'm optimistic that'll become second nature soon enough.

Heading: Great phone
Text: I wasn’t planning on getting a new phone but was impressive with the oled screen. I’m not a fan of the bigger phones so I preferred the max. Don’t waste your money on 64gb. Pay up and get the extra storage. You are gonna want to use this phone for what it’s built for: high quality videos and photos. Video games

Heading: iPhone 11 Pro Max
Text: Let me say I, along with my family, are Apple people. With 4 iPhones, 3 MacBook Pros, three iPads, and an Airport Time Capsule, we like Apple. As for the newest iPhone 11 Pro, not so good. The screen and camera are great, when they work correctly. IOS 13 has been plagued with issues since receiving the phone. I’m sure Apple is active in correcting the issues, but personally I believe they released it too soon. Due to the issues I’ve had, sadly I can’t recommend it as of yet. Any phone is only as good as it’s operating system, which sadly hasn’t been that great...

Heading: iPhone 11 Pro Max
Text: Wow!  I am enjoying and getting acquainted with my new iPhone 11 Pro Max.  Photography is my thing so I am experimenting.

Heading: Great camera
Text: I love this phone, battery life is excellent. I would highly recommend this phone

Heading: Avid Apple
Text: This by far is one of my best purchases by far. Buy it as Best Buy made it so much less painless then to go into the Verizion store and deal with all the bs

Heading: Great Phone
Text: same as other IPhones.. I haven’t found anything too overly impressive other than satisfaction of having the latest phone

Heading: Love my new phone
Text: First time getting the Max series for an iPhone. Not to hard go get use too. Love the new features for the 11.

Heading: Enthusiast level iPhone.
Text: I upgraded from a 256gb X. I justified the upgrade by getting the Pro Max instead of just the Pro. So far, I am loving everything about the pro max. Highly recommend.

Heading: Great phone.
Text: Great phone but needs instruction manual to enjoy it’s features.  No instructions were given by the sales person.

Heading: Great phone!
Text: Coming from Samsung to Apple I had my doubts but I love my iPhone. The screen resolution and the speed are amazing. The 3 cameras had me off at first but if you’re into photography than it’s a great thing! Great pictures and video. I got the 256gb and that is plenty! No complaints here and glad to be on team Apple.

Heading: iPhone 11 Pro Max
Text: I love my new iphone.  Has great features and the camera quality if wonderful

Heading: Upgrade
Text: I upgraded to the 11 pro max from a 6plus, and I am glad i did, I was just gonna get the 11. I am happy with my decision. Merry Christmas

Heading: Amazing phone
Text: Love it and still working on all it can do!!  I was afraid I would miss the home button but it was a super easy transition.

Heading: Great camera
Text: Easy to use. Love the camera. Fast to log into phone with face recognition.

Heading: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE!
Text: Why the hell did I put off upgrading for all this time?  TO GET THIS PHONE!  Love it!  Can't say enough and I have know idea how to use it to it's max and I still love it!!!!

Heading: Great phone
Text: Phone is simple to use. Great visual and audio quality. A wide range of features to choose from. So much can be accomplished on a single device. The battery life is amazing.  Does not need to be charged frequently and the new lightning speed charger charges quickly.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Upgraded from my iPhone X. My plan has an annual upgrade option so was excited to try the new iPhone 11 Pro Max. BB Techs setup my phone including apps. You may need to re-enter password info first time opening apps. Still exploring the new features.

Heading: Great
Text: Apple never fails. Another great iPhone with a better than ever camera

Heading: excellent service
Text: excellent service ....   knowledgable , patient and respectful people

Heading: Love it!
Text: My daughter had the XS Max and it was always getting disabled. Even sitting on a flat surface not moving it would somehow become disabled by itself.  So she upgraded to this one and so far it has not been disabled once!  It is fast, facial recognition is great and she LOVES the camera.

Heading: Great phone.
Text: I can’t say enough how fast and accurate the execution of tasks are on this phone!! Amazing speed and processor. It is rare and unique phone that comes around once in ......!!!!  Lo light pictures are in the level as an professional photographer. Camera and video on this phone is a masterpiece. Thank you apple.

Heading: Not yet disappointed
Text: Went from a note 9 android device to an iPhone promax 11 I’m not disappointed at all the fun has done everything I needed to do it has exceeded my expectations so far

Heading: Great Camera!
Text: I love it. The camera is crystal clear and design is nice and sleek.

Heading: I upgraded from an iPhone 7 plus.
Text: This screen is amazing! the speed of my apps is awesome and the camera is the best ever that Ive had in an iPhone. took a couple days to get used to not having a home button but now I don't give it a second thought. The notch at the top, is there one? LOL I don't even notice it. Super happy with my new phone.

Heading: Best iPhone I’ve owned...
Text: I upgraded from a 7s to the 11 Pro Max, in large part due to the improved cameras but have been impressed with the enhanced battery life and speed of the processor.  The camera has been as advertised - it takes amazing pictures and videos and the widescreen option is a game changer.

Heading: Nice upgrade

The man at the Apple store just recommended that I not even use one since the glass is so strong.The only reason for four stars instead of five is the cost is somewhat ridiculous. What you get though, it was expected.

Heading: Great Phone!

Heading: Awesome phone

Heading: Really it's just another iphone
Text: I read these reviews and see a very common theme in what's been left forbothers to read, " great upgrade", " love the new features especially the camera". Let's be really honest here it's the exact same phone that has came out over the last 3 years, pretty much since the "limited edition" iPhone x, which ended up not being limited at all and became the current apple standard. It's what to expect from apple, luxury build quality great display, Thanks Samsung!! Or LG for the cheaper models. The only difference really is the cameras which is only catching up to what the Google pixel kicked off with the low light phenomena bringing crystal clear pics in the darkest settings apple of course dumps every high end part available right down to the screws I'm sure are dipped in unicorn sweat just because why not as for a great upgrade not really at all if you bought a iPhone in the last 2 years save your money your not missing anything at all except the capability not to upgrade to iOS 13, there some pretty major flaws and privacy concerns surrounding this build so if your one of the smart ones who hasn't upgrade I would continue not to if I where you at least for a few months when all the security issues are patched that being said in display touch id, 5g and sure to be revolutionary camera upgrades are all to come in the iPhone 12 and from what I've heard and read there's some really exciting groundbreaking and a complete build overhaul coming so if coming from say iPhone 8 then this is for you iPhone X and up hang on to your cash after all this will be obsolete in 6 months by apples standards at least hold off for the next round because 1500 dollars plus for a couple camera upgrades and USB C charging finally is not worth the cost of a decent car

Heading: Love the NEW iPHONE 11 Pro Max
Text:
The biggest upgrade in the new iPhone 11 Pro Max is the three new cameras. These cameras are fantastic! The wide and telephoto lens work so well and make pictures look great. Night mode also works great and the pictures I have taken in low light look awesome. 

The OLED screen is so brilliant. I have watched Youtube and movies I have in 4K on the phone. They look terrific and the ohone has Dolby Atmos sound. Great experience!

I also love the size. It is almost too big for my pockets, but I don't care because the size is perfect for using the phone, and there is more space to see the images and videos and websites on the phone.

I have not found a negative point in the new iPhone 11 Pro Max.

I previously had the iPhone XR and I like this one much better.

Heading: Microphone and camera issues
Text: This is a beautiful phone in the midnight green but comes at a price. There are quirks that have no fix right now. While using the speaker, or Bluetooth in the car, the sound is like an echo with airplane noises. I’ve tried everything and the only thing that helps is to turn the volume down very low but then I can’t hear my caller. The camera utilizes widescreen on the back camera so while FaceTiming, the other person sees distortion of plus Yiu can see pixels as you move the phone around. Lastly, it took five hours to get service at the store. It took a Samsung expert to help the manager by suggesting to swap out the new SIMS card, which was defective. Unless you get this phone on sale, which I did, I would wait to see if the microphone and widescreen distortion gets fixed. Not a happy camper and thinking of returning within the 14-day exchange since I feel this phone is defective.

Text: I’m glad I stuck with Apple. I was pondering between the pixel four and the Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max. Looks like pixel four is a bust even though it takes good pictures. I’m glad I stuck with apple seems to be a very solid phone great speed it looks Keep growing on me.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Phone is good and pictures are awesome.  One down side is not having a home button.  I have an iphone for a long time and they have always had the home button.  I find my self trying to click on the home button, that's no longer there.  Opening the phone and closing open programs are all done by sliding up.  Iphone 11 is a big learning curve from the iphone 8 plus.  I do like all the features that are available with the camera.

Heading: If you want a good Smartphone go Android
Text:
I've had this phone for just over a month so I feel like I've had enough time to really give a fair judgement: The phone is fine. It's a good smartphone and does what a smartphone is intended. 

But my god does this phone feel like such a drag after using android and pixel. 

The camera quality on my two year old pixel is way better than this new iphone and it was able to do more. This iphone camera feels very limiting. The pictures are sub-par quality. They're fine if you take casual photos but if you're trying to take something nice then forget it. 

It had trouble with wifi no matter where I'm at. In fact it seems like Wifi only slows it down! I had the same issue the last time I had an iphone so at this point I think it's an apple problem. 

I could go on but there is just almost no quality in this phone where an android or pixel isn't better. 

And then the price is ridiculous! You pay more for a phone that's just okay. 

If you want to get your money's worth then go for the samsung galaxy or google pixel. Not only are they usually cheaper but they are loads better and can do more. At this point iphone is more of a fashion accessory or status symbol.

Heading: Huge Upgrade
Text: I didn’t realize how much of the scene was missing from my pictures until I started using the ultra wide camera lens. It should come standard on all flagships! The camera system is absolutely amazing. I am really impressed with Night Mode. The OLED display is stunning, and I love Dark Mode in iOS 13! I thought I would miss Burst Mode, but I think I like taking Slofies more. I also like the added ability to adjust settings within Apple’s Camera app. Despite all the complaints about iOS 13, I have had very few problems, much less than I did with any of the Android smartphones I had a few years ago. The only major thing I don’t like about iPhones is the high price.

I don’t miss touching the button at the bottom, you just swipe upwards on the line (same thing!).  
When Best Buy had this phone on sale for a Christmas sale, I ordered it immediately!  Verizon sale was buy one/get one (a lesser phone), but I did not need 2 phones/2 lines and the 1st phone was full price.  Best Buy was there for me again!!

Heading: BB Customer Service was great about screen issue!
Text:
I'm a huge fan of Apple products, and a long-time owner of a succession of iPhones.  A lot more expensive than other brands, but the quality has always been worth it.  The durability has allowed me to "live life" without worrying about breakage resulting from normal, everyday use.  

I'm always very mindful of how I handle my electronics, and NEVER careless; vigilant but not paranoid.  Do I toss it in my pocketbook?  Of course!  Do I put it in the back pocket of my jeans once in a while?  Who doesn't?   

With no change in my day-to-day use, in 4 days, the screen of this "11" had a couple of fractures!  It was not dropped, and nothing hit it; nor did anything scratch or gouge it.  I immediately went back to BB to discuss the issue, and it was resolved with an exchange and the recommendation of a tempered glass screen protector.  I did get the screen protector for the replacement iPhone, and it's a good thing I did...  I’ve already had to replace that, yesterday, for the same problem:  unexplained fracture.  (This time the iPhone screen "survived.")

Apparently this model is the first one that can't be popped in my back pocket for a few minutes to free up my hands.  I believe it's a design flaw and I'll be watching to see if this is noted as a common occurrence.  While I love everything else about it, this would be one concern in "recommending" it.  

Best Buy, regarding the required yes/no answer regarding recommendation, there should be a third option: "unsure."

Heading: Bring back the thumbprint scanner
Text: I traded in an 8Plus for the 11 Pro Max. Functionally, there is very little difference between the two. The camera on the 11 is definitely better (but the 8Plus was really good anyway), the battery lasts longer and the fast charger is good.  Speedwise it a little slicker but not by much. My gripe with this phone is the facial recognition. It is inconvenient and aggravating. You really have to get the right angle to be recognized, and if you pick up your phone a lot, having to swipe and hold the phone to your face only to have to type in the passcode or reswipe again, becomes aggravating and wears on you. Also, if you wear sunglasses, you need to remove them for it to work.  Extremely inconvenient. The thumbprint scanner was solid and almost never failed.  This is a great phone in almost all respects, but the inconsistent facial recognition performance is enough to knock not just one but two stars off for me.  In hindsight, I wish I had kept my 8Plus and waited for something better down the road. Save your money and wait for something better.

Heading: Windows Phone Was SOO Much Better
Text:
I've been using Windows Phone for years.  Finally made the change to iPhone.  It feels like I've gone back in time by 5 years!  My phone is no longer a "smart" phone, it is an aggravating dumb phone!  iOS is awful at allowing me to use my phone the way I want!  Tried getting custom ringtones, and that was a grueling ordeal.  Tried downloading files to the phone and it was a nightmare.  Calendar doesn't work as well as Windows Phone, Contacts on iPhone are a nightmare mess of a disaster with no rhyme or reason to the photo associated with them. My wife told me to stop thinking logically and just feel good about my phone.  That's the Apple experience in a nutshell.

The phone itself is nice hardware, but my screen cracked after 3 days while the phone was in my pocket!  Not my back pocket, in my front pocket!  Forbes wrote an article about this problem with the iPhone 11 models.  I tried taking it back for exchange but Best Buy refused to take it. They said I had to buy Apple Care for $200 then pay another $30 to have the screen fixed.  On a $1,200 phone that is less than a week old.

The battery life is incredible on this phone.  Lasts 4 days between charging.  Charging takes about 1-2 hours.

iOS is almost catching up to Windows (5 years late).  It finally has a built in swipe keyboard, and it finally has dark mode.  But most things I try to do with iOS are more like I'm fighting and battling my phone rather than the phone helping me.  Don't even bother trying to get all your photos to display in the photos app... I have to go to each separate app like OneDrive or iCloud to see photos in each location.  Windows Phone was so much better in almost every way... I can't comprehend why people settled for this inferior clunky pain in the neck OS on their phones.

APPLE NEEDS TO DO SOMETHING AS I AM NOT THE ONLY ONE THAT HAS THIS PROBLEM.
